p.p: This field holds a list of all IN2 routines related to the Application (e.g. ACCOUNT, CUSTOMER).
This acts as a link field to get the id for EB.ALTERNATE.KEY, while an alternate key is used as a field input.

desc.p: Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
Multi-value field.
Input is the maximum number of Characters to be used as an ACCOUNT ID.
This field is also used for Alternate Key processing for SECTOR and INDUSTRY applications.
Maximum length of alternate key for SECTOR, INDUSTRY should be specified here.
The SECTOR and INDUSTRY fields in applications will get resized to the length specified here.
This can be of any length irrespective of the current key field length defined in the application program.
This will allow the actual alternate value input to be accepted by the lowest level validation routines.
Alternate key max length for ACCOUNT, CUSTOMER will be referred from ALT.KEY.MAX.LENGTH field in EB.ALTERNATE.KEY.
Used for formatting purposes only.
None, but should be less than 26.
ID of the EB.OBJECT record.
Validation Rule:
Any alphanumeric characters.
VAL.ROUTINE
Locally developed routine to perform additional validation & to apply particular
format to the key structure.
Must exist on the PGM.FILE as a type S program
This field is used to get the EB.ALTERNATE.KEY id during field input of alternate keys.
The checkfile to be used for this object. This field is for future development.
1 to 35 type A (alphanumeric) character field
Must be a valid record on the FILE.CONTROL table
Describes the EB.OBJECT code and is used to provide the enrichment of the code.
1 to 35 type A (Alphanumeric) character field
This field specifies the field to be used as the enrichment field. This is for future development.
1 to 35 type A (alphanumeric) character field
The value entered, must be a valid field on the STANDARD.SELECTION record of the checkfile
